The castle was built by the Hugues II and Hugues III, Lords of Farcheville and Bouville. The great hall was built in 1291 and the castle chapel was consacrated in 1304. Both father and son were [[Chamberlain (office)|chamberlain]] to [[Philip IV of France]]. The structure possesses a rare northern French example of arched [[machicolations]] on buttresses, more characteristic of military architecture in the [[Languedoc]]. The castle passed to the family of ChÃ¢tillon in the fifteenth century.<ref>{{cite book| last = Mesqui | first = Jean | authorlink = | coauthors = | title = Chateaux-forts et fortifications en France | publisher = Flammarion | year = 1997 | location = Paris | pages = 493 pp | url = | doi = | isbn = 2080122711 }}</ref>
The castle was built by the Hugues II and Hugues III, Lords of Farcheville and Bouville. The great hall was built in 1291 and the castle chapel was consacrated in 1304. Both father and son were [[Chamberlain (office)|chamberlain]] to [[Philip IV of France]]. The structure possesses a rare northern French example of arched [[machicolations]] on buttresses, more characteristic of military architecture in the [[Languedoc]]. The castle passed to the family of ChÃ¢tillon in the fifteenth century.<ref>{{cite book| last = Mesqui | first = Jean | authorlink = | coauthors = | title = Chateaux-forts et fortifications en France | publisher = Flammarion | year = 1997 | location = Paris | pages = 493 pp | url = | doi = | isbn = 2080122711 }}</ref>
â
The castle is now owned by Edra Blixseth age 55. The castle is currently for sale for $57 million U.S. dollars. The castle has its own moat, hunting grounds, 15 bedrooms, {{convert|1000|acre|km2}}, and a [[helipad]] <ref>http://offshoreinn.com/international_real_estate_property/castle-for-sale-chateau-de-farcheville/</ref>. Edra Blilxseth is facing [[personal bankruptcy]] because of the collapse of her and her husband's real estate empire. Edra Blixseth is now facing paying creditors over $400,000,000.
+
The castle is now owned by ''[[Edra Blixseth]]'' age 55. The castle is currently for sale for $57 million U.S. dollars. The castle has its own moat, hunting grounds, 15 bedrooms, {{convert|1000|acre|km2}}, and a [[helipad]] <ref>http://offshoreinn.com/international_real_estate_property/castle-for-sale-chateau-de-farcheville/</ref>. Edra Blilxseth is facing [[personal bankruptcy]] because of the collapse of her and her husband's real estate empire. Edra Blixseth is now facing paying creditors over $400,000,000.
